text.p: HeavyLift-VolgaDnepr has added a ninth Antonov 124-100 to its fleet, the Anglo-Russian joint venture cargo airline said in a press release.

The firm, part of the Norwegian industrial group Kvaerner ASA, said that the combination of HeavyLift's marketing and the capability of the 124-100 had enabled it to capture over 60 percent of all international outsize and abnormal air cargo shipments.
New loading techniques enable the airline to carry one-piece loads of up to 120 tonnes on a single flight or 54 cars.

It said past shipments have included flying the nuclear reactor for the Space Station Freedom from St Petersburg to Albuquerque, New Mexico, taking a pair of 72.5 turbines from Texas to the UK and lifting 130 tonnes of mono-cargo equipment from Amsterdam to Perth, Australia to repair offshore oil rigs. - Air Cargo Newsroom Tel+44 171 542 7706 Fax+44 171 542 5017
